newsitem.title: ITALY: Generali ups holding in BCI.
newsitem.headline: Generali ups holding in BCI.

text.p: Italy's largest insurance company Generali has increased its stake in Banca Commerciale Italiana by one percent, lifting its overall holding to 4.95 percent, the insurer's managing director said.

Gianfranco Gutty told a shareholders' meeting that Generali's total stake in BCI was worth some 345 billion lire at current market value. He gave no details of when the further shares were bought, or at what price.
Gutty said the decision to take a bigger holding in BCI would have "important consequences" for Generali's own operations.
Generali already markets life insurance and pension policies in coordination with BCI units, especially in South America. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
